rComments: I personally liked having Hu as my ECE190 professor. It is true that he doesn't seem to care much about his students. He skipped the first day of lecture and randomly went to Singapore without announcement and made the other professor cover his sections for a couple weeks. But he targets the savvy students so you'll learn a lot if you are above avg
Good lecturer but a mean guy, plz do not cheat in his class!!
i've never met a teacher who cares less about his students. avoid ece classes taught by him if possible
Very helpful, extremely clear and friendly.

While funny and very smart, he can't teach at all.  He goes way too fast, and assumes knowledge students may not have a firm grasp.  I am doing well in the class, but its because I'm skipping his lectures and attending LeMay's lectures.  She is WAY better at teaching than he could even try to be, avoid Hu if you want to actually learn something
Worksheets were very helpful... quizzes and exams were not hard. A little accent but a very nice person.

This man is a nice, and he is funny, but he is a horrible teacher. He is very very smart, and therefore assumes everyone else is too. For example, he told us our final was "easy" and he also told us what ? I don't remember what the average was, but it was low, and none of what he said was on the final showed up...
Professor Hu is funny and one of the smartest teachers in ECE I'd say, but he's not that good of a teacher. You're going to have to teach yourself most of the stuff.

He told us what to study for the final, and none of those came out on test.  He said that the final was easy, but the class average turned out to be 46%.  I thought finally there's a good ece professor at U of I, turned out they are all the same, trying to wipe people out.

Professor Hu is awesome!!! The subject is quite confusing but he's able to come up with good examples. Good sense of humor. However, you can easily get lost in class because he speeds through the materials.
